examples.description: Office building in Oslo CBD, built 2018, government tenant (Ministry of Finance), 12 years remaining on lease, BREEAM Excellent.
examples.analysis: Prime CBD location (4.50-5.25% range). Government tenant and long lease = very low risk. Modern building with certification. Position at low end of range, slight compression for quality.

result.reasoning: Prime CBD, government tenant, long lease, modern certified building - bond-like characteristics justify lowest yields

examples.description: Office building in Oslo Lysaker, built 2005, single tenant (mid-sized IT company), 4 years remaining on lease.
examples.analysis: Lysaker range is 5.50-7.00%. Single corporate tenant with medium lease. Building is 20 years old. Position mid-range, slight expansion for tenant and building factors.

result.reasoning: Lysaker mid-range positioning, single tenant adds concentration risk, older building needs consideration, medium lease term

examples.description: Logistics warehouse outside Bergen, built 1995, three tenants (logistics companies), average 6 years remaining.
examples.analysis: Logistics Normal range 6.50-9.50%. Diversified tenants good. Old building is concern. Medium lease. Secondary location.

result.reasoning: Secondary logistics location, older building requiring capex, partially offset by diversified tenant base and reasonable lease terms

examples.description: Prime retail unit on Karl Johans gate, Oslo, built 1920 but fully refurbished 2022, H&M as anchor tenant, 8 years remaining on lease.
examples.analysis: Retail Prime range 5.25-6.00%. Prime location on main shopping street. Strong anchor tenant. Recently refurbished despite old building. Position at lower end of range.

result.reasoning: Prime high-street retail location with strong international tenant, recent refurbishment mitigates building age concerns

examples.description: Office building in Trondheim city centre, built 2012, multi-tenant with mix of professional services firms, average 5 years WAULT, energy label B.
examples.analysis: Trondheim range 5.50-8.00%. Diversified tenant base is positive. Reasonable building age and energy standard. Medium lease terms. Position mid-range.

result.reasoning: Regional city office with diversified tenants, modern-ish building with decent energy performance, lease terms at market norm
